submapp.som.Som.time_info¶

property Som.time_info¶

For each class, info about the instants t at which it has been used

First are stored all instants t at which the kth class has been used as BMU in t_as_bmu[k]. Then in order to help to detect whether each classes represent well a certain period the mean and the standard deviation of t_as_bmu[k] are computed for all k in [|0, nb_class -1 |].

Note that len(t_as_bmu[k])= occ_bmu_map[k]

Warning

Note that this attribute is meaningless if the SOM is not used with time-series or if each input has a different scale of time.

Returns

(

  • mean(t_as_bmu[k]),

  • standard_deviation(t_as_bmu[k]),

  • t_as_bmu

)

Return type

Tuple[np.ndarray[float], np.ndarray[float], List[int]]
